div.p: A personalized public education where children learn the value of community and the environment
The environment is at the center of everything we do.
Through innovative educational experiences graduates are academically prepared, confident of who they are and environmentally responsible.
We partner with parents to provide children with a personalized education experience, where children learn the value of education, community and the environment.
Children are empowered to make a positive difference for themselves and their communities.

h2.a: Lottery Night Results for School Year 2020-2021

div.p: On March 9th, 2020 we conducted our lottery for the 2020-2021 school year. Thank you to all who applied, it is our honor and pleasure to partner with you on your child's academic journey. Click this link to view the results from the lottery.

h2.a: THIS HAS BEEN POSTPONED AS OF 4/7/2020 Announcement: NEW ELECTION TIMELINES FOR PCCS BOARD OF DIRECTORS POSITIONS

div.p: NEW ELECTION TIMELINES FOR PCCS BOARD OF DIRECTORS POSITIONS February 24, 2020 Dear PCCS Parents, In response to feedback from the PCCS community and board position applicants, the PCCS Board of Directors will now be conducting the Parent-Elect and Board-Appointed...

p.span: Prairie Crossing Charter School is a free, public school. There are no admission exams or tuition costs to attend for students that reside in Woodland District 50 and Fremont District 79.
Prairie Crossing Charter School is open for 185 days of school attendance a year. Students in 1st through 8th grade attend school from 8am-3:30pm and Kindergarten students attend school from 8am-1pm.
